content: J By: James Hawkins November 10, 2011 Adwords Agencies, Don't Get Mesmerized by Pretty Graphs Paid Search Marketing (PPC) I'm head of online marketing at a lead generation company which has a very large internal spend on Adwords, and we also manage Adwords accounts for other clients. I personally deal with about 70 campaigns, so looking at them all weekly needs to be done efficiently. This is a very step-by-step guide on how we operate daily to do so efficiently without wasting hundreds of hours lost in the world of statistics! It applies to the Search Network, not the Display Network. Read this post D By: Dan Roche November 3, 2011 Useful PPC Tactics for Online Retailers Paid Search Marketing (PPC) In PPC, the retail industry is one of the toughest areas to crack in terms of managing a successful campaign. There are many reasons for this, as online stores try to stand out from the crowd by holding frequent sales, product giveaways, offering free delivery and distributing voucher codes. Some online shops claim to have year-round sales which are always quite amusing as their prices seem to remain the same. Read this post By: Chad Hill October 24, 2011 Use Analytics to Set Pay-Per-Click Campaign Goals Paid Search Marketing (PPC) Anyone that has worked in SEO in any capacity knows that it's a complex business and you learn something new just about every day. But the ultimate SEO goal is easily defined: improved search rankings. It's challenging and somewhat frustrating because of the unknowns of search engines (alright...Google). But at my firm, we have an extremely fine-tuned SEO process that works for us and for our SEO resellers. Read this post E By: Ed Fry October 14, 2011 What SEOs Must Learn from Adwords Folks Paid Search Marketing (PPC) AdWords folks. They're the traders of the online marketing world. They spend their time analyzing scoreboards, making little improvements and brainstorming their next ideas. They split-test their ideas, scale the best and ditch the best. In a world where scarce resources force them to make choices over budget, positioning and copy, they're having to think totally differently to SEOs... Read this post M By: Matt Davidson September 28, 2011 Considerations for Targeting Specific Devices and Platforms using PPC Paid Search Marketing (PPC) In the last couple of years, the mobile web has taken off considerably. This has allowed advertisers to target content at mobile devices, users and reap the rewards. Structure your accounts properly. Firstly, account and campaign architecture based around devices is key. Create your campaigns based on the individual devices you are targeting. This will all... Read this post B By: Bryce Bertola September 14, 2011 Multiple Stage Remarketing Campaigns Paid Search Marketing (PPC) First of all, What is Remarketing? In case you've been living under a rock for the past year, Remarketing is a form of interest-based advertising used by Google. Joanna Lord did a great job of explaining it here on this post about Remarketing. The short version is that you tag a visitor who comes to your website with a browser based cookie, then Google uses that cookie to serve your display ads across the web. Read this post D By: Dan Roche September 7, 2011 7 Killer Tools in AdWords Editor Paid Search Marketing (PPC) In PPC management time is always an issue, and a minute cannot be wasted waiting for a web page to load or for changes to your account to be saved. That's why it's vital to use Google AdWords Editor in PPC management. The time saved using this tool is unbelievable and can be time spent optimising your client's account rather than manually changing bids and adding keywords on the AdWords interface. Read this post By: Joanna Lord July 26, 2011 Leveraging your SEO for Search Retargeting Paid Search Marketing (PPC) Here at Moz we work hard to break down those silly silo things (frankly they scare us). We believe that the different pieces of marketing should constantly be communicating with each other. Cyrus (our SEO lead) and I try to communicate on what we are seeing, where we might be overlapping, dropping the proverbial ball and so on and so forth. We know that leveraging each person's daily activities for maximum impact is the key to any company's success. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers July 18, 2011 Bing Quality Scores: Match-Types & Magic Wands Paid Search Marketing (PPC) We Bing PPC campaign managers have coasted too long on broad-match keywords, but the new quality scores may change all of that. Narrower match types may even turn out to be a magic wand on performance. The topic of retargeting and remarketing is hot, hot, hot. As more blog posts get written and more resources get pushed out, there still seems to be quite a bit of confusion around what it actually is, and how it is different from regular display media buys. What effect has this had? A company I have been working with activated sitelinks in their AdWords ads on search for CompanyName. They also ranked #1 organically on this search phrase.
